elements.title: Truganini (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, upon the death of Truganini (pictured), the Aboriginal population of Tasmania was declared to be extinct?

elements.title: 141 Schools for Peace (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 141 Schools for Peace campaign was formed in the aftermath of the 2014 Peshawar school massacre and received proceeds from "We Will Fly"?

elements.title: a retired manufacturing CEO (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a retired manufacturing CEO and a former Muppeteer co-produced a biopic of Dietrich Bonhoeffer?

elements.title: Otago Farmers Market (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Otago Farmers Market celebrated its birthday with a "long lunch" on a railway platform?

elements.title: Tilly Norwood (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the AI creation Tilly Norwood has been described as "really, really scary"?

elements.title: Music for the Masses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Depeche Mode chose to follow a set of rules, including one against using chords, when they recorded their 1987 album Music for the Masses?

elements.title: Bea Sprung (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bea Sprung credits her competitive swimming background with aiding her development as a footballer?

elements.title: Trinity Communion Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Trinity Communion Church in New York erected a 10-foot (3.0 m) papier-mâché pink elephant on its lawn to increase its visibility in its neighborhood?

elements.title: Alexander Sabar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alexander Sabar feared thesis defense more than terrorists?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

El Cuyo

El Cuyo beckons to visitors looking for a quiet, natural seaside town to bask in the sun undisturbed by revelers while other visitors seek adrenaline-pumping excitement.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
